subject: p12530259
History: Lobectomy with elevated hemidiaphragm and extensive opacification.
Findings: In comparison with a series of images from and, there has been progressive decrease in the pleural fluid in the left hemithorax, though some persists. Elevation of the hemidiaphragm with mild shift of the mediastinum to the left is consistent with previous surgery. The right lung is clear and there is no vascular congestion.
